result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L Vanremortel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by Dept. of Corrections.
No contact with any member of law enforcement when they are off duty or their family members. No contact with G.Z. or S.Z., their residence or their minor children.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

supervisions.notes: Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served.
To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

Jury finds defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct as charged in the complaint.
voir dire list, jury seating chart, random listing report, juror selection and peremptory challenges
State Exh. 1 - Google map of Neenah Ave., Exh. 2 - JOC for case 13-CF-51.

Defendant Eric L Vanremortel in court with attorney Jonathan J Gigot.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court discusses some preliminary matters with counsel. Clerk advises we are waiting for 2 people from Washington Island yet. Court will wait until they get here before proceeding. Recess 8:35 am. Back in session 9:04 am. Voir dire begins. Oath of Qualification given. Oath of Trial Panel given. Recess 10:02 am. Back in session 10:20 am. State requests phone appearance for Dep. LaViolette because of a family emergency. Defense leaves it to Court's discretion. Defendant has no objection. Court grants request. Defense requests sequestration of witnesses. Court grants request. State/Defense give opening statements. Greg Zager sworn, testifies. State Exh. 1 - map of Neenah Ave. Offered and received. Cross, redirect. Shelly Zager sworn, testifies. Cross, redirect. Marcus Tassoul sworn, testifies. Cross, redirect. Randall Tassoul sworn, testifies. Cross, redirect. Matthew Rollin sworn, testifies. Cross. Jury excused for lunch. Court questions whether defendant will be testifying or not. Atty Gigot indicates defendant will not be testifying. Court questions defendant on his right to testify or not testify, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly waiving his right to testify. Recess 11:53 am. Back in session 12:46 pm. Dep. Robert LaViolette, sworn, testifies by phone. Cross. State rests. Defense will not be calling any witnesses. Jury excused. Jury instruction conference with counsel.  Jury returns. State/Defense give closinging arguments. State gives rebuttal argument. Oath of Bailiff given. Jury to deliberations 1:34 pm. Recess. Back in session 1:54 pm. Jury returns with verdict. Jury finds defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct. Court polls jury. Jury excused. State requests judgment on verdict. Court finds defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct. Court receives State Exh. 2 into the record. Sentencing scheduled for 8/24/17 at 8:00 am. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Eric L Vanremortel in court with attorney Jonathan J Gigot.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates this matter is now in the #1 position for trial. Matter will proceed to trial as scheduled. Bond remains in effect.

Attorney Jonathan J Gigot in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gigot ready to proceed today without defendant, wasn't able to get in touch with him to let him know about todays hearing. Court addresses State's Other Acts motion. Atty Gigot gives argument on motion. State responds to Atty Gigot's argument. Court makes statement, won't allow #3 of State's Other Acts motion in at trial, will allow #1, 2 & 4 in.
from ADA Korb requesting court set hearing to address their other acts motion. Court sets hearing.
